line: Are you a wireframe? Because I can see the structure of my future with you.
You must be made with Figma, because you've got all the right curves and constraints.
Are you Helvetica? Because you're exactly my type.
You must be a Bezier curve, because you bend my heart in all the right ways.
I’d never ghost you—unless it’s a layer in Photoshop.
You must be a UI component, because I want to reuse you in all my projects.
You're the grid to my layout, perfectly aligned in my life.
Are you a color palette? Because you brighten up my entire world.
You auto-layout my heart every time you smile.
Let’s make a prototype—so I can show you how we work together.
Are you a mockup? Because you make my rough ideas look amazing.
You're not a bug, you're a feature I didn't know I needed.
You must be Adobe XD, because every interaction with you feels like magic.
Are you responsive? Because you adapt perfectly to every situation.
Even my drop shadows fall for you.
Are you a prototype? Because I can’t wait to turn you into something real.
You're like a bold font — you stand out in every crowd.
I must be using a blur effect, because I’m lost in your focus.
If you were a CSS class, you’d be .perfect-alignment.
You're better than a high-res mockup — you're the final build.
You must be a drop shadow, because you give me depth.
Are you a gradient? Because you're making my life blend beautifully.
I’d kerning closer to you any day.
You’re the white space in my chaotic life.
You're like a well-designed logo — unforgettable and iconic.
Your alignment must be center — because you're always on point.
If I were a font, I’d want to be paired with you forever.
I’d never put you in a frame — you’re the whole canvas.
I love the way you handle negative space — especially when I’m missing you.
You must be in vector format — flawless at any scale.
